homura.modules.functional package¶

Submodules¶

homura.modules.functional.convert module¶

homura.modules.functional.convert.to_onehot(target: torch.Tensor, num_classes: int) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Convert given target tensor to onehot format

Parameters

  • target – LongTensor of BxCx(optional dimensions)

  • num_classes – number of classes

Returns

homura.modules.functional.discretization module¶

homura.modules.functional.discretization.gumbel_softmax(input: torch.Tensor, dim: int, temp: float) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

gumbel softmax

homura.modules.functional.discretization.gumbel_sigmoid(input: torch.Tensor, temp: float) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

gumbel sigmoid function

homura.modules.functional.discretization.straight_through_estimator(input: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

straight through estimator

>>> straight_through_estimator(torch.randn(3, 3))
tensor([[0., 1., 0.],
        [0., 1., 1.],
        [0., 0., 1.]])
homura.modules.functional.discretization.semantic_hashing(input: torch.Tensor, is_training: bool) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Semantic hashing

>>> semantic_hashing(torch.randn(3, 3), True) # by 0.5
tensor([[0.3515, 0.0918, 0.7717],
        [0.8246, 0.1620, 0.0689],
        [1.0000, 0.3575, 0.6598]])

>>> semantic_hashing(torch.randn(3, 3), False)
tensor([[0., 0., 1.],
        [0., 1., 1.],
        [0., 1., 1.]])

homura.modules.functional.loss module¶

homura.modules.functional.loss.cross_entropy_with_softlabels(input: torch.Tensor, target: torch.Tensor, reduction: str = 'mean') → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Cross entropy with soft labels. Unlike torch.nn.functional.cross_entropy, target is expected to be one-hot or soft label.

Parameters

  • input – Tensor of BxCx(optional dimensions)

  • target – Tensor of BxCx(optional dimensions)

  • reduction –

Returns
